subject: Re: [junit] Heap size
msgSnippet: ... Runtime.maxMemory or MemoryMXBean give adequate information about the maximum heap size, so failing early is indeed not difficult. Most of the time I run
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:
>
>
> Mark,
>
> Failing early should be reasonably easy, if you have a trusted API for
> determining heap size. Do you have a runner that would know how to
> fork a JVM, if the annotation existed?
>
> David
>
>

Runtime.maxMemory or MemoryMXBean give adequate information about the
maximum heap size, so failing early is indeed not difficult. Most of the
time I run within Intellij IDEA (which by default forks a JVM to run
tests). It gets rather irritating to have to specify the memory
requirements for every individual test in a class (when running them
individually), so it would be nice if the environment could pick up the
requirement from somewhere. Before someone points out that I could set a
default heap size for tests in IDEA, I have other tests which fail if
the Java heap is too large. There is no single value which will work for
all tests.

I will think about writing a runner which will fork a JVM and report the
result back to the original JVM.

Thanks for your interest,
Mark Thornton
